Friday I am ordering the parts to build a computer with KSP in mind. 4GHz Quad core chip, Radon 260X GDDR3 2G, liquid cooling, 8G RAM (for now).

It actually (Heavily modded) has a watchable framerate to about 400 parts and is a slideshow past 600.

I hope this will give me a watchable framerate to 1000 parts. Since it is so hevily CPU dependent I can skimp a bit on the graphics card. Although it is still a huge improvement over my current setup of a 2.2 GHz Quad core and a HD7400M 512 MB card in my Acer Aspire notebook.

Of course the computer will inherit the 32" LG HDTV I currently use for a monitor.

It is my birthday present to myself......and Jeb and the boys.

With shipping it el cheapo, it's gonna be a looooong week and a half......
Money well spent, in my opinion. Jeb and the boys will be ecstatic!
Well, atleast it won't be for just KSP, others should improve... right?
I jelly, bro.

Yeah, a heavily modded Skyrim, Civ V, and GTA IV (another game I keep hitting a memory overload on due to mods, but graphic, not RAM).

I'm certain computers have other uses.....they must.......meh, who cares...It will make a kickin 54th Birthday for sure!

(currently 780 hrs since it went on Steam. Only CIV V. Medieval II, and Medieval ROME I have more...and not by much. All of them have been on the computer longer than KSP. KSP is about 15 months old on my system....since 0.18)

Edited March 5, 2014 by pslytely psycho
I just dropped $1500 on a new beast of a machine, (somewhat) primarily for KSP...though I have other things that I'll be using it for as well.

And that's the beauty of a PC. Versatile and upgradable. By months end I may be able to add a second graphics card and more memory (in the hope KSP will eventually be 64 bit....Please!)

Not to mention Mods.....and KSP has the best. I have had less problems (excluding memory overloads) from KSP mods than from any other game. Right now I have around 30 mods and it loads up to about 3G, on mine it dies at about 3.7G. I'm actually pleased I get the performance I do out of it. Can't wait until it has some horsepower to play with!

Sooo cheap! Try seeing what that money would get you in the UK!

[Edit for below - you pay roughly half what we'd have to. USD$740 would be GBPÃ‚Â£440 (just checked) which would be a good-ish laptop - something more than just surfing the web and twitface but not much in the way of graphics.]

Edited March 6, 2014 by pslytely psycho
You're describing exactly what I'm going through. I'm ordering an awesome new computer, and now it's hard to play KSP on my older machine, as I know the frame rates will be much higher soon...
AMD FX 4350 4.2 ghz costs Ã‚Â£94, about $160

Yes it is. I should have it built by the following weekend if there are no shipping delays. I have a half constructed (486 part) ship in orbit awaiting its living quarters and lander(212 parts). It is such a slideshow when they get near that I am saving my quicksave and not playing that gamesave until I have it built. Very hard to make delicate manuvours at 2 FPS....
The electricity the game eats up still costs more

The nice thing about living in Washington state. Hydroelectric. I pay .089 cents per KW hour. For my one bedroom apartment that averages around $62 a month. With electric heat in the winter and A/C in the summer.
Yes , my laptop keeps my lap nice and warm when I'm launching a 500 pt rockstrosity
Jebediah approves.

I hope "4ghz" means you're overclocking, instead of getting a CPU with that stock clock, because a 4670k is almost certainly a better buy for KSP

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/42877-CPU-Performance-Database

Edited March 6, 2014 by TranquilTempest

Don't expect anything amazing when it comes to graphics performance from this game. My new computer I just built with a 4770K overclocked to 4.2 GHz and a gtx 780 SC that can play BF4 on high settings at 5760x1200 resolution still struggles with KSP at 1920x1080. Well I shouldn't say struggle, it doesn't even break a sweat. The game just isn't fully optimized, I only get about 15 fps viewing my orbiter lab with a few ships docked to it. If I change the graphics from everything maxed to everything minimum I maybe get 17 fps.

If it's primarily for KSP, I wouldn't be worrying too much about that RAM.

I have 16GB, of which KSP uses roughly 20% max. So irritating when I have out of memory crashes. 32bit nonsense...

The nice thing about living in Washington state. Hydroelectric. I pay .089 cents per KW hour. For my one bedroom apartment that averages around $62 a month. With electric heat in the winter and A/C in the summer.

How on earth do you manage to spend 62 dollars on 0.089 CENTS per kWh electricity? In a one bedroom appartment!? That's tickling 70 MEGAWATT-hour per month! Even if you meant 0,089 dollar (so 8,9 cents) that's still 700 kWh per month. Which is doable I suppose, but still very high for a one-bedroom appartment IMO. I average around 10 kWh per day in a two bedroom apartment with electric water heating, A/C, a big fridge and ofcourse my computer. I just don't get it

Then again I have a bit more incentive to be frugal since electricity here runs around $0.35-.40 per kWh
